snippet: Growth in industrial production, retail sales and investment in fixed assets like factories and office buildings was little changed from April.
abstract: Chinese economy, widely seen until the last few weeks as the strongest remaining locomotive that could drag the global economy back from the brink of recession, shows a second month of anemic growth in May and performed even worse than the already lowered expectations of most economists; growth in industrial production, retail sales and investment in fixed assets like factories and office buildings was little changed from April.
lead_paragraph: Growth in industrial production, retail sales and investment in fixed assets like factories and office buildings was little changed from April.

headline.seo: Chinese Economy Shows a Second Month of Anemic Growth
headline.main: Affirming Slowdown, China Reports Second Month of Scant Economic Growth
headline.print_headline: Second Month of Slow Economic Growth in China
